metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4975 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Possible CRLF injection allowing HTTP response splitting attacks for siteswhich use mod_userdir. This issue was mitigated by changes made in 2.4.25and 2.2.32 which prohibit CR or LF injection into the "Location" or otheroutbound header key or value. Fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.25 (Affected2.4.1-2.4.23). Fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.2.32 (Affected 2.2.0-2.2.31).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4975` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2').
